Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: TripDoc46
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, been here couple times, it is really great since upgrades. Starbucks downstairs now, very convenient, pool is great in season. Clean, nice rooms, very comfortable and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: texasbondgrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month on a business trip with my boyfriend. We chose the Hyatt Place based on price and location, as it was a quick cab ride from an event we were attending at the Angelkia Theatre. I have to say I was blown away with how friendly everyone was!! As soon as we entered we were greeted by two wonderful gentlemen, who made us feel like part of the family (Jerome and Matt) We even got to pick our floor. The room was amazing, so clean and such a cool and functional layout. It had a nice living room area which was perfect for us to relax before the event. The front desk was able to quickly call us a cab and we were off. When we returned later that evening, Adrian was on staff. He poured us a couple of nightcaps and got us some snacks, even heated it up a second time so we could bring them back to our room. He was soo friendly and again, made us feel at home. The bed was so comfortable and we had a great nights stay. In the morning, there was a great selection of breakfast items to choose from. It was a wonderful stay and we will definitely choose Hyatt Place again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brenda G
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Dallas for a medical procedure, we decided to book a room near the facility as opposed to fighting Dallas morning traffic. Our room was spacious, very clean & cozy! The staff was very friendly & fun to chat with. They serve Starbucks coffee, too!! The location was perfect for getting to my appointment so early in the a.m. & was convenient on/off the highway. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good area”
Reviews.Author: wannabefoodieHouston
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before. The location is awkard to find at first, but once you know the ins and outs, it's easy to get on or off the freeway. It has a mini space for kitchen, which has a sink, mini fridge and a coffee maker. Tons of counter space for brushing teeth, the toilet/shower is tiny. Nice desk space, couch space to relax, and turnable TV. The only thing that I'm not happy with are the towels. They are worn and has a dark tint to it. Most hotels use bleach to whiten the towels and an added bonus as disinfectant. So, I hope that was a fluke. The check-in person was grumpy, so even though the lobby and food area is welcoming, I hate to go down to that area just to avoid her.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location for a weekend stay"”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Temple_TX
Reviews.Content: We met our college daughter and her 2 roommates in Dallas for the Arkansas/A&M game the 1st weekend of October. The game was at Cowboy stadium, and easy to access from the hotel. Staff had a mix-up and gave us rooms far from each other, but no harm done. The breakfast was undistinguished, and for us, did not matter, because we planned to go out to brunch. The bed, as usual, at Hyatt, was great. Great flat panel TV. I was able to get this on Hotwire with just a couple of days' notice.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: BlueJetta
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great! The lobby and common areas are very nice and refreshed. However, the room had an "old" feel to it, and the studio style offers no privacy if you are traveling with someone. The location is VERY easy to get to and find from the highway. Would recommend to anyone as long as they're not paying full price. Breakfast was decent, lots of room to sit down and eat in the lobby area with TVs. Parking is ample and the pool always looked nice and clean (didn't have a chance to use it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel@good price”
Reviews.Author: dcjw700
Reviews.Content: Nice business hotel. Rooms are clean and functional. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is ok; nothing great. Stay here several times/month; very happy with price..just over $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Brown Tap Water Probably Put a Bad Taste in Our Mouth...”
Reviews.Author: Andiecob1
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for his business event in Dallas and I went along for the ride. We were actually kind of excited about this hotel because it was such a great deal and being a Hyatt we were expecting great quality and service. After the 4+ hour drive we check in and get into our rooms, ready to wash off a bit and realize that the water coming out of the faucets is a dark brown color and smells of sewage. I was mortified. We checked both sinks and the shower and actually got video footage. Then we called the front desk and asked if they were aware of any problems expecting them to be apologetic and maybe even having us move to another hotel. No reaction. They said they'd send someone up to our room. No one ever came so I went downstairs to try to find some potable water. When I turned on the faucet in the ladies down stairs-- same thing! Disgusting. I asked the front desk person if they knew of any plumbing problems and she said no but called her manager. When she was finally able to track someone down by phone he said that yes by the way they had shut the water off earlier in the day and this happens. We should let the water run a while and it should be fine. We never received an apology. No one ever checked up on us to find out if the situation had been resolved. Nothing. Very, very disappointed. And disgusted. How does this happen? Really?

Reviews.Title: “Facilities need attention”
Reviews.Author: OaklandJeff
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the room was spacious and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. However, the facilities really need attention: - Desk phone in room doesn't work - Bathroom exhaust fan is extremely loud - Room door was not well sealed, therefore noise from hallway comes into the room loud and clear (including what I assume was a staff member loudly moving supplies at 4 AM) - The sole elliptical machine in the workout room doesn't work

Reviews.Title: “nice clean affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: atxgrl79
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location and friendly staff. the room was large and clean. the breakfast was typical...english muffin/bagel/toast, fruit, yogurt,cereal and juice. although there are some small corners in the room where you can tell there has been a remodel overall its very nice and comfortable. the pillows are awesome! and the large flat screen is the perfect finishing touch. this was my second stay at hyatt park central and i plan on staying again if i make any future trips to dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Andangi
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hyatt Place was extremely pleasant. I've stayed at a Hyatt Place in Austin and this one in Dallas was better! The location is great as it sits right off Hwy 75 and the hotel service was satisfactory. With free parking and continental breakfast, the value couldn't be beat ($60/night)!! The rooms are all suites, so there is plenty of room to spread out and get comfy. I really enjoy the separate living area. The bathroom area is decent, although a little cramped. Breakfast was very light and perfect to just get the day started!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerously slippery shower”
Reviews.Author: busyworkingmomof3
Reviews.Content: I slipped and fell in the shower. There were no handrails and I hit my head really hard, sprained or broke my finger, and banged up my knee. I talked to someone at Hyatt Corporate Affairs. She said she left a message for the General Manager at the Hyatt Place Park Center who would call me back the following Monday. I never heard back from anyone. I am afraid someone is going to get hurt badly before they take their unsafe showers serious.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: moe40moe
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very helpful whether it was asking about a place to eat, where our meeting was, or how to get on the right highway to get home they were wonderful. The breakfast was good with a good selection. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. If we needed anything the brought it to the room in a timely manner. If you are attending a class at the University of Phoneix it right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay, loved it”
Reviews.Author: mbtran321
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri and Sat night. Looked simple from outside, but inside was great layout and design/decor/smell. Very modern contemporary flow and clean. Booked a double bed room. Enjoyed the separate living room with the large couches and pull out possible couch. Mini fridge and side bar sink was great for counter space and extra space. The table and wifi were PERFECT, no lag Enjoyed how the bathtub was not in same room at sink so it can be used outside. Food was healthy choices for the breakfast buffet Fruit/Veges Cereals selections Dougnuts Bagel Muffins Various Juices/tea etc Also can order own items as well Rooms were quiet in between except doors sounds will travel. Location is great and right of the hiway for easy access and moving around town Did not utilize the workout room, computer business room. Room kept in good shape

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place for family w/ kids”
Reviews.Author: plumeria9
Reviews.Content: My family and I had planned on visiting Dallas the day after Christmas. Plans had to be changed a bit, so my husband called this hotel to adjust our reservation, and it was not a problem, they honored the rate I booked under, which was a pretty good rate. We stayed for three nights. This also happened to be a day after Dallas received snow, which doesn't happen very often, so there was a lot of ice in the parking lot in the front. Not to worry, we just parked in the back after our initial slippery experience. My girls had the best time playing in the snow at the front of the hotel! The fellow we dealt with at the desk, unfortunately I misplaced his name, he was very helpful and the kind of guy you would like to be running your front desk if you owned a hotel. He tried to help us find someplace to eat, as it was Christmas day, and pretty much nothing was open. He gave us a list of restaurants, and even made some phone calls. Eventually, we struck out on our own, and discovered that the nearby NorthPark mall had some restaurants open, because there was a huge movie theatre there. The room was decent; a bit small, but at least bigger than a regular hotel room. Our two girls slept in the fold-out couch, which was a fun treat for them. The only complaint I have is minor or typical, the heater/ a/c unit (better than a window unit, but not central) cycled on and off all night, and I would wake up w/ the changes. If I just left it on, it would have been too hot. Also, w/ the ice on the road, I heard several sirens throughout the night on our first night, but not too many thereafter. I like these Hyatt Place hotels because of the suite set up, and the small refrigerator and sink in the room. It was also nice to have complimentary internet access, which you don't often get. The complimentary continental breakfast was okay, but it would have been better if the folks in charge of it kept the utensils stocked. Each morning, I noticed there were either no or just a few forks left in the holder, so I would grab what we needed so we were covered. I almost chose a Hampton Inn(Hilton family) over this hotel because they offered a complimentary cook-to-order breakfast, but my lower room rate was enough to cover the cost of breakfast if this one was not enough. Fortunately w/ all of the mini yogurt cups, bowls of cereal, bagels, and donuts, we were plenty full, and saved money to boot. Actually, I bought Hyatt gift certificates at Costco for $80 per $100, and saved $50 more on my trip. However, I didn't get Hyatt points for anything but the part I actually charged at the hotel. I prefer the Hyatt Gold Passport loyalty club over the Hilton Honors club, because w/ the Hyatt club, your points don't expire, and the Hilton ones expire after one year of no activity. With young kids, we don't always get to stay at hotels of our choice throughout the year, so it's nice when your stays count without expiring.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and gm brad is great”
Reviews.Author: tmbas
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is amazing would recomend it to anyone. The beds are just like the one in our home. The tv has a great picture staff is kind espicially brad the gm he has gone above and beyond to please us. This is the only hotel we will ever stay at when we come to the dallas fort worth area worth the trip everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Really felt like Home.”
Reviews.Author: TriniPixie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a comfortable 4 nights in room 301. Bedroom, living, kitchen and desk areas of the suite were very roomy, however even though it was kept very clean, it was tight to move around in the small bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful no matter what hour of the day, the gym was ok ( a bike and a couple of treadmills but in a spacious, clean room). No restaurant but there was a 24hr deli serving sandwiches, desserts and Starbucks coffees in the lobby area. Stay away from ordering off of the menu which also acts as the room service menu, like I said there is no restaurant. At first we kept missing the exit for the hotel off 75 but it it quickly became one of the best locations for staying in Dallas. Hardly any traffic on Churchill Way and easy to head in any direction. Would probably stay there again as it really did feel like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Printman2000
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed with this hotel from the minute I got there. Extremely clean, fashionable and new looking. The room I had was huge. Two full size bed and a lounge area that had a sectional sofa with a hide-a-bed. A Family of 4 or 5 could easily fit in this room. Decor seems brand new and well maintained. HUGE flat screen TV with HD channels. The room also had a fridge. The breakfast was okay, nothing special. Comparable to most free breakfast at hotels. No hot items but they did have a big toaster machine that you could run your bread/bagel through. Other than that, some fruit or cereal. Staff was friendly, though I chose to check in and out through the automated kiosk at the front. It was quick and efficient. I will for sure be using this hotel again when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: dramatrice
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for business. Good food onsite available 24 hours, extensive fresh breakfast, small but functional fitness room, wireless internet, free area shuttle, really great staff, what more could you want? Oh yeah, a comfy bed, big room with work area, great bathroom with full-length mirror, big TV, etc. And the style is very elegant. I always stay at this hotel when I'm in Dallas for business.

Reviews.Title: “The updates are Amazing :-)”
Reviews.Author: Apert
Reviews.Content: This hotel use to be an Amerisuites and was old and needed updating badly. It is super nice now..Modern decorations..the beds are very comfy.. Nice Big flat screen TV. Free continental Breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good but what a pain in the neck”
Reviews.Author: friendlyinsomniac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in room 210. The place is totally remodeled, the older traveler photos are outdated as this place has been completely updated. I am submitting new photos with this review. The suites are large with comfortable sitting area, 56" flat panel TV and modern appointments. The rooms are quiet considering how close this place is to the busy expressway and I did not experience interaction with any children as noted by a previous submitter on this site. In room climate control worked well. There is a mini-fridge and wet bar area in the living room side. The bed, however, I think was not updated in the renovation of the property. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and difficult to get much sleep on. After three nights I went to get a massage who found I had 7 knots in my neck and shoulders. If you can sleep easily on such a bed you may just love this hotel. Everything other than the bed is perfect. Beware that the extremely limited breakfast offerings and coffee are removed promptly at 9am. I have stayed in Hampton Inns and other places where they at least leave the coffee available, not here. There is a Starbucks at 635/Coit, about 1/2 mile away, if you need to perk up. There are computers with free internet and printer access in the lobby - that is a nice touch! I would stay here again if I could get some assurance that the bed was swapped out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value, good bed”
Reviews.Author: hotelSNOBArkansas
Reviews.Content: Always love a hyatt place...this one is no different. Actually booked this through Hotels.com and our reservation was not in the system when we got there. However, they took care of it at once and even gave us a discount for the trouble. The only complaint I have is that the bathrooms are VERY small.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: mikemo
Reviews.Content: Great, if you don't want a quiet room and don't want breakfast with a million children. I lived just nearby for 25 years, so you better know your way around Dallas. M

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Harjoe453
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hotel while attending the Cotton Bowl. My wife and I enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the Dallas area. Members of the staff were some of the nicest people I have met working in the Hotel industry. When we needed directions, they were there to help. When we needed the shuttle, they responded without hesitation. In addition to a top notch staff, the hotel was first rate. Our room, as well as the hotel itself, was clean and well maintained. We experienced some TV issues dealing with HD channels, but those issues were minor and did not diminish our overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice " homey place"”
Reviews.Author: TownCountryTerry
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel-had never stayed in a Hyatt Home place prior. best part of stay-night staff. Very friendly. Room was nice, wish I could have stayed longer . Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: kkingmd
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for business travellers. It is more a mini-suite than a full suite. There is a large, comfortable couch and ottoman with a beautiful 42 inch LCD HD TV, free internet and the usual business amenities. Rooms are very clean, well appointed and very recently remodeled. The closet is small and hard to get to, but this is a small problem. The staff was incredibly attentive, very courteous and provided service on par with a much more expensive hotel. The food was above average but expensive. Sodas were uncommonly expensive (nearly $3 for a 20 oz bottle) but... This is NOT a good hotel for small children and the rooms do not have a separate room/living area like a true suite hotel (such as Embassy Suites).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for this price range!”
Reviews.Author: KathleenB1977
Reviews.Content: Midweek prices in Dallas can be a real shock so I was looking for a better priced alternative to the usual place I stay while in Dallas for a quick trip... They will be sorry that their midweek price sent me to the newly renovated Hyatt Place because I will never go back after finding this hidden gem on 75 near 635! What a great surprise... I read the reviews on here saying it had been redone and upgraded with 42" flat screen televisions but for the $129 price for a Wednesday in Dallas I was blown away by the boutique hotel feel and extremely courteous front desk staff. The room was perfectly appointed with granite counters, mini fridge, wonderful comfy beds and that wow factor 42" flat screen... I didn't think I'd get any sleep because I was so happy enjoying my room! A pleasant continental breakfast is embellished with some great custom order and pay options and the starbuck's coffee choices and constantly available crisp granny smith apples have made a quick fan of me. I'll be back again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jmurphyjohnson
Reviews.Content: This is now the Hyatt Place, Dallas Park Central.....fantastic rooms with a 42" plasma television, and brand new furniture and amenities. Felt like we were staying in a much more expensive boutique hotel. Brand new super comfortable bed, wet bar, refrigerator, and fold out sofa. Located almost next to the High Five interchange at 75-North and 635, there was a bit of traffic noise, but nothing that keep us awake. The staff was friendly and attentive, and especially Kim who among her other duties, drives the courtesy van to any location within 5-10 miles. Definitely a find in a sea of bad choices in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Very Inviting”
Reviews.Author: reneoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Amerisuites for three nights. We drove to Dallas to see a comedy show and just have a long weekend. The service is very friendly. The rooms are exactly as they look on the website. Not luxury but very much acceptible for the price. Our room was very clean and all the amenities worked properly. Take advantage of the free breakfast, it was actually very delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Its an Amerisuites not a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: AUTUMNSUN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly what it claims to be, a 2 star hotel. It was clean but basic. The furniture was clean and in good shape but had that "cheap" look to them. The air worked fine and I had no problem with leaks or oders. The bed was of average comfort but the sheets were on the rough side. I used the self serve laundry facilities. They have one washer and one dryer and it costs $1 each to use them. You can get detergent and softener at the front desk for $1. The breakfast in the AM consisted of scrambled eggs, sausage, make it yourself waffles, pastries, cereals etc. It was very crowded and they ran out of plates. They have one waffle maker. They also have the slowest elevators I have ever seen. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is just off the interstate and easily accesible to downtown. It is in a safe area and the hotel clientele were mainly tourists. I stayed here for two nights using my Hyatt gold points. I would not stay here again unless it were free but I am partial to "nicer" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not very nice”
Reviews.Author: loriyand
Reviews.Content: When I got to my room it was musky and then I realized the airconditioner didn't work.. They changed my room and there was a leak under the sink..they changed me again and the room was "ok".. the rooms are dark and depressing and you and you can hear every noise. the breakfast was nothing special even though they advertise a "bountiful buffet" its not. This hotel is not even close to being 2 1/2 stars. maybe 1. If you have a choice stay away.

Reviews.Title: “For business travelers only”
Reviews.Author: davissummer24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Amerisuites for one night with boyfriend. The hotel is really clean although I did receive a double room when I reserved a king room. The problem was fixed very quickly.The room was clean although in no way shape or form a suite in my opinion. There is a wall that separates the bedroom from the sitting area and I found the room the smallest suite I've ever seen. The kitchen is functional with small fridge, microwave, and stove. However, the problem is insulation. We heard every noise going on outside from the construction, the people upstairs, the people walking by outside in the hallways. There is no insulation to guard against noise. Didn't get a good nights sleep at all. The heating unit is one of those in the wall units that only heats the immediate area which wouldn't be a problem if Texas was not having an ice storm that day so it was freezing! The breakfast buffet was decent as long as you don't mind warming it up. There are very few restaurants nearby and the staff is not very knowledgable. I would not return but may be economical choice for business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic, well presented and clean. Staff were lacking local knowledge however were very friendly. Breakfast was plentiful and free. Suites would suit family, strongly advise to hire a car as hotel a bit out off the way from down town. Places worth seeing South Fork Ranch, 6 Flags theme park, Billy Bobs(Fort Worth)

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Dallas / Park Central
HotelInfo.Address: 12411 N Central Expwy, Dallas, TX 75243 (Formerly AmeriSuites)
